org.onehippo.forge.content.pojo.common.util

Class GlobPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.onehippo.forge.content.pojo.common.util.GlobPattern

  • public class GlobPattern
extends Object
    GlobPattern

    Translate glob expression into regular expression to compile pattern. Inspired by org/apache/oro/text/GlobCompiler.java.

    This compiler supports the following glob syntax:

    Task Example
    Match one or zero unknown characters ?at matches at, Cat, cat, Bat or bat
    Match any number of unknown characters ?at matches Cat, cat, Bat or bat, but not at
    Match any number of unknown characters Law* matches Law, Laws, or Lawyer
    Match a character as part of a group of characters [CB]at matches Cat or Bat but not cat or bat
    Note: This compiler escapes all the meta characters such as '*', '.', etc. from the expression input automatically.

    Refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glob_%28programming%29 for general information on glob expression.

    • Method Detail

      • isQuestionMatchesZero

        public boolean isQuestionMatchesZero()
        Returns the flag whether this compiler creates a pattern matching zero unknown character by '?' expression. If true, it matches with zero unknown character by '?'. Otherwise, it matches only with one unknown character by '?'.
        Returns:
        flag whether this compiler creates a pattern matching zero unknown character by '?' expression

      • setQuestionMatchesZero

        public void setQuestionMatchesZero(boolean questionMatchesZero)
        Sets the flag whether this compiler creates a pattern matching zero character by '?' expression. If set to true, it matches with zero unknown character by '?'. Otherwise, it matches only with one unknown character by '?'.
        Parameters:
        questionMatchesZero - questionMatchesZero

      • compile

        public Pattern compile(String globExpr,
                       int options)
        Compiles the glob expression and returns a Pattern object with the Java reglar expresson compile option.

        options - The Java regular expression compile option such as Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE.
